name: EOD Regional Nodes
title: EOD Regional Nodes
notes:
**Note 1:** **Regional nodes and nodes, NOS**  
* Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in EOD Mets.

**Note 2:** **FIGO and lymph node detail** 
* When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and lymph node detail are available, record the code with lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage.

**Note 3:** **Isolated tumor cells** 
* Isolated tumor cells (ITCs) are defined as single tumor cells or small clusters not greater than 0.2 mm, usually detected by immunohistochemical (IHC) or molecular methods. ITCs do not usually show evidence of malignant activity (e.g., proliferation or stromal reaction). Lymph nodes with ITCs only are not counted as positive nodes. 
* For positive ITCs with NO regional lymph node involvement, code 040

**Note 4:** **Regional lymph nodes include**
- Femoral
- Inguinal, NOS
  + Inguinofemoral (groin)
  + Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
  + Superficial inguinal

**Note 5:** **Lymph nodes, NOS** 
* Code 800 if regional lymph nodes are involved, but there is no indication which ones are involved.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(5) **Introduction to Female Reproductive Organs**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(6) Gibb, R.K., Olawaiye, A.B., Mutch, D.G., et al. **Vulva**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(7) **Vulva,** from the AJCC Cancer Staging System Version 9 (2023). Used with permission of the American College of Surgeons, Chicago, Illinois.
rows:
Isolated tumor cells lymph node metastasis less than or equal to 0.2 mm
Single cells or clusters of cells less than or equal to 200 cells in a single lymph node cross section

Non-fixed, non-ulcerated or UNKNOWN if fixed or ulcerated, lymph node involvement
* Size of metastasis greater than 0.2 mm but less than or equal to 2.0 mm

Non-fixed, non-ulcerated or UNKNOWN if fixed or ulcerated, lymph node involvement
* Size of metastasis greater than 2.0 mm but less than or equal to 5 mm

FIGO Stage IIIA

Non-fixed, non-ulcerated or UNKNOWN if fixed or ulcerated, lymph node involvement 
* Size of metastasis greater than 5 mm

FIGO Stage IIIB

Non-fixed, non-ulcerated or UNKNOWN if fixed or ulcerated, lymph node involvement 
* With extranodal extension (ENE)

FIGO Stage IIIC

Non-fixed, non-ulcerated or UNKNOWN if fixed or ulcerated, lymph node involvement 
* Size of metastasis unknown AND
* UNKNOWN if extranodal extension (ENE)

FIGO Stage III

Fixed or ulcerated lymph node involvement

FIGO Stage IVA based on lymph node involvement

Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph node(s), NOS

Unknown; regional lymph node(s) not stated
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed
Not documented in medical record

Death Certificate Only
